unnormalised: Mumbai, India - Efficient inventory management is increasingly crucial for Indian manufacturers navigating volatile market demands. Experts at IIT-Delhi are emphasizing the importance of accurate inventory forecasting techniques.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading supply chain professor, highlights that "Precise forecasting minimizes stockouts, prevents costly overstocking, and ultimately boosts profitability for businesses, big or small, like the local khadi cooperative in Jaipur."

unnormalised: Advanced algorithms, incorporating factors like seasonal demand (especially during Diwali), raw material price fluctuations (measured in Rs. per unit), and lead times from suppliers (ranging from 2 days to 2 weeks, depending on location - say, a factory in Chennai vs. one in Himachal Pradesh) are being implemented.
normalised: Advanced algorithms, incorporating factors like seasonal demand (especially during Diwali), raw material price fluctuations (measured in rupees per unit), and lead times from suppliers (ranging from two days to two weeks, depending on location - say, a factory in Chennai versus one in Himachal Pradesh) are being implemented.

unnormalised: Poor forecasting can lead to wasted warehouse space (costing Rs. 50 per sq ft in some industrial zones) and tie up crucial capital. Companies adopting robust forecasting models are seeing significant reductions in waste and improved responsiveness to customer needs, ensuring they can deliver that perfect saree or machine part just in time.
